newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Costello says sticks by employment forecast.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Costello says sticks by employment forecast.

text.p: Australian Treasurer Peter Costello said on Tuesday the government was sticking to its forecast for unemployment in the year to June 1997 and that the government's decision to set up a Cabinet employment committee was not a concession that the jobs situation was worsening.
"We actually forecast that unemployment would fall over the current year and by the year's end be about 8.25 percent," Costello told reporters.
"We think there are very good growth prospects and we stand by all of the forecasts that we made," he said.
"We indicated in the budget we expect good employment growth over the course of the year, we think we will get that," Costello said.
"But the important thing to remember is we have got to look two, three, four, five years down the track and that's what we are doing," he said.
Asked if the establishment of the Cabinet committee was a concession that unemployment was about to get a lot worse, he said: "Of course it's not."
